snippet: Every night, rickety wooden boats ferry a stream of refugees, some walking and some wounded, to the safety of Turkey as the bloodshed in Syria escalates.
abstract: Altinozu Township Journal; growing stream of refugees, many of them wounded, is flowing over the Syrian border into the relative safety of Turkey; wounded risk long trips rather than submit to arrest at government-controlled hospitals; Turkish authorities estimate that region's refugee camps contain over 11,000 people.

byline.contributor: Sebnem Arsu and Hwaida Saad contributed reporting.
